page.title: 13Health
page.content: Most children in our school had injections against diphtheria and whooping cough when a few weeks old. At 2 years they had injections against polio and measles.At our school we have a medical and the dentist comes to see if we need treatment.Every term the school nurse comes to look at our hair and nails. She has talks with us about growing up and keeping clean.At Secondary school you have another medical and more injections.The most common illnesses today are coughs,mumps,chicken pox and influenza.Our doctor has a surgery in Kibworth and Great Glen.Some people go to surgeries in Market Harborough.If we go to hospital we go to Leicester or Kettering.We also have a Cottage Hospital in Harborough.It treats burns and does stitches but not operations. It is also a Maternity Hospital.
